Children is insufficient to account for

and

language is not just a tool for

competence the internal knowledge of

in real world

represents the pure linguis itic

significant contributions chumsky makes
in language and mind is his critique of
behaviorism particularly through his
famous review of B F Skinner s verbal
behavior in this critique chumsky argues
that language cannot be reduced to
conditioned responses he points out that
language is far more complex and
Abstract involving deep cognitive

key component of his generative grammar
Theory this concept explains how deep

transformational grammar allows us to
understand how complex sentences are
formed from simple ones highlighting the
flexibility and creativity of human
language he uses the example of
sentences like John is easy to please

different deep structures the creative
aspect of language is a central theme in
chsky s work he emphasizes that human

this generative capacity according to

ability and reveals the complexity of

the importance of the brain in language

Linguistics and cognitive science

Shifting the focus from behaviorist
